text: You always look so beautiful... especially in the morning. Tara smiles her thanks. They begin to kiss.

Audrey Lanford's office.
So...did he say it? Tara turns her attention to Dana who also wears a headset they just raised their voices they could talk normally.
No. But he's giving me a drawer.
Sounds like love to me. (holding up a list) Here's the final list of all the people coming. I got a hold of James Linfield this morning. He sounded cute. Tara checks him off her list.

What if you invited ex-girlfriends? Tara looks at the list as if for the first time.

Not you...him. Here are all your ex- girlfriends from the past five years! (beat)

He's a good-looking, single, straight money maker in Manhattan. Obviously if you've never heard even a name of an ex, you just haven't had that talk yet. Tara suddenly looks worried.
When are you supposed to have that talk?
Never. Tara glances over to the cubicle next to hers.
Just pretend you can't hear us.
When the relationship gets serious.
We're serious.

But you haven't said "I love you" or talked about moving in together or marriage -- Dana is interrupted by an EXPLOSION OF APPLAUSE AND CHEER They turn to see -~- GROUP OF MALE CO-WORKERS “high fivin’” each other as a CA KLEIN BILLBOARD goes up across the street. I might not know every little detail about Nate’s past, but I do know he isn’t into pre-pubescent, anorexic, airbrushed, fake fantasy models. (looking at slobbering men) I’m finally in a relationship where I don’t have to be suspicious and worried all the time.
A cozy table by the window. Nate and Tara lean into one another, talking. A WAITER comes to the table carrying a BIRTHDAY CAKE with a candle. Nate leans across the table kisses her.
Nate tries to unlock the door while unbuttoning the hundr pearl buttons down Tara's back.
I'm not going to get this off of you until midnight -- Tara wriggles around to face him.
Careful, it's vintage...

I'm just looking forward to being alone with you. Nate kisses her while pushing open the door...
Flicks on the light --
Nate grabs Tara as DOZENS pop out of nowhere. He quickly looks around to see all his FRIENDS and CO-WORKERS. He smiles at Tara, shaking his head.
Tara and Dana stand off to the side, watching late GUESTS arrive. Beautiful WOMAN after beautiful WOMAN walk throug the door. Dana nudges Tara as they greet Nate.
That was casual... A tall, BLONDE brushes Nate's cheek with a "hello", a BRUNETTE waits her turn. They hug. DANA (cont'd) That was a little warmer than just co- worker, don't you think?
Dana ~~ But you can see that Tara is evaluating each and every wo the same way. She straightens her dress self-consciously. TARA (cont'd) I better get their coats.
Nate talks with a slick-looking, Wall Street-type, ALEX M
All I know is she's back and she's asking about you.
I'm in a relationship, Alex. (shrugging) Tara's only twenty-two...but she doesn't play mind games, she knows who she is. (taking a drink) I'm the fucked up one.
Tara staggers forward carrying a huge PILE of COATS.
But aren't you even a little curious to see her? Tara FREEZES. She cranes her neck around the coats, they haven't seen her yet.
No. (beat) So..-how is she?
See...see, you are. You think about her, too. Don't deny it! realizes Tara quickly steps all the way into the closet, closing t slatted door behind her.
Tara presses her face against the slats, watching Nate.
Things are going well with Tara --
You've only been going out with her a couple of months --
(whispers) Six --
You're not married, you're not even living with her -- Tara watches on in horror.
I'm not calling her.
You two were a great couple --
And then she dumped me and moved to London --
And now she’s back --
What do you care? Alex crosses his arms.

I just think there might still be something there between you two. When you two got engaged, you were the envy of every guy I knew -- Tara’s mouth drops open. ALEX (cont’d) She’s so smart, and beautiful...incredible --
So, you ran into her?
No, I heard through George that she’s still talking about ‘you.
It’s all in the past, now. I’m going to get a drink. Nate walks away. Alex follows.
I just want you to be sure about this. Tara follows them with her eyes, unaware as a MAN opens t closet door. Tara BURSTS forward, FALLING ON TOP OF HIM, burying him under coats.
The party is over. Dozens of glasses cover every surface. Ashtrays and wine bottles and general post-party disarray Tara follows Nate, collecting glasses.
So you liked everyone that came...and no one was missing?
No, in fact, there were a few people I wouldn't expect at my birthday party.
Oh?
My accountant...uh, my dentist and my plumber all assured me that they had a great time.
I wasn't sure from your phone book... (laughing) But that was alright?

Great. I'm scheduled for a free cleaning next week, my taxes will be done early this year and if we ever have a blockage, we can call Phil at home. (kissing her) Thank you. Nate picks up more glasses, heading for the kitchen. Tara follows.

You have so many nice friends...George and his wife Sandy, you know, the newlyweds...they seem so happy. Of course I've never been close to getting married, so I wouldn't know about that. (beat) What about you?
Marriage? Not really.
Did you ever feel like proposing. ..looked at rings, that kind of thing?
Why are you asking?
I don't know...I just realized after talking to all your friends...and people from work, that there's a lot of stuff I don't know. Like...were any of your ex- girlfriends here tonight?
No.
So, do you see any of your ex— girlfriends, are you still friends with any of them?
Absolutely not.
It would be fine if you were, I'm just asking. Is there anyone you would like to keep in contact with?
Did Dana put you up to this?
What? No.  10.
I wouldn’t take advice from a woman who can’t even commit to a long distance carrier --

I can tell you about my ex-boyfriends --
No thank you.
I just mean I can share -—
I don't think the past has anything to do with us, with what we have right now. Look, things are going well, right? You're happy? Nate takes Tara's hands in his.
Yes, but I don't like the idea of other people..acquaintances of yours, knowing more about you than I do --
If something came up that was about one of them, something relevant -~—
We're talking about it. It's relevant -—
Why do you want to know this stuff?
To bring us closer together. Nate pulls her into an embrace.
I can think of better ways of bringing us closer together.  11.

(smiles) Alright...I’m letting you off the hook now, but I do want to talk about it...later, because I want to know you better and because... She stares into his eyes...and she can't stop herself. TARA (cont'd) I love you. There, she said it, blurted it, really. Nate stares deeply back into her eyes. They stay this way for what feels like forever. He pulls her close and then kisses her...on the forehead.
On the forehead? Tara nods sullenly. DANA (cont'd) Oh my God. Tara, what did I tell you? Never, ever, ever, ever say it first --
Too late.
Look, it's so basic. We're animals, just watch dogs. It's the males who go around sniffing our butts, not the other way around --
I think it's a little more complicated than that --

Is it? Rudge broke up with me because I made it too easy for him. I liked him and let it show, and what did he do to repay me? He went back to his bitchy ex- girlfriend who treated him like shit. (MORE)
DANA (cont'd) I treated him like a God and to repay me he skated. By telling Nate you love him, you've disturbed nature's balance. Tara puts her head on the table.
Please...I can't breathe... Dana lowers her face to Tara's level.
Let's just go over what you heard again. Tara sits up.
She was the most intense relationship he ever had. He almost married her. Everyone wanted her. He was in love with her and so was everyone else --
Got it. So, you may be the rebound.

Rebound...oh God, that's gotta be it. (beat) And he wouldn't tell me about her last night because...he's still in love with her. Dana, what if that's it? He thought this woman was out of his life, and now she's back...and he can't stop thinking about her. That's why he didn't say he loved me back. Tara starts to cry. Dana hands her a tissue, patting her the shoulder.
Hold on. Maybe not. Let me think... Tara wipes her tears, hopeful. DANA (cont'd) (long beat) On the forehead? Tara lets her head drop back onto the table. CuT TO:  13.
Everyone else has left except for Tara and Dana who walk together. They step onto:

You're going to go back there, act like nothing is wrong. Act confident. They sense that. He may just be waiting for an appropriate time to tell you he loves you. Don't sweat it. Confidence. Tara nods to her coach, straightens her coat.
Confident.

Great. C'mon in... (beat) You want something to drink...eat? Nate heads back to the kitchen. Tara wanders around the apartment, passing the bedroom. She STOPS in her tracks w she sees a SUITCASE on the bed, PACKED.
Nate...where are you going? Nate appears.

I tried to tell you before the party... Nate looks at Tara. NATE (cont'd) I have a job interview in San Francisco. It's for a non-profit...a friend set me up with these people...I wasn't looking.  14.
San Francisco? That’s in a different time zone. Nate takes Tara's hands in his.
I haven't even thought this through. I...I'm just going to see... He hugs her, but doesn't say any more.
Nate hands her a key.

I'll be gone for a week...if you could feed Uncle Pussy. Make sure you feed him twice a day, he'll scavenge if you don't...make sure he doesn't have people food. Nate gestures over to a fat CAT sitting on the window sil NATE (cont'd) Uh...plants are fake...except the orchid on the table, but I just watered it...uh, bring in the mail...you don't have to answer the phone, I'll retrieve my messages.
What if you want to call me?
I'll ring once, hang up, then call right back.

Tara is dressed in an oversized sweater of Nate's. She smells it periodically, staring at two WOMEN selling rhinestone jewelry on the home shopping network. The BUZZ rings. Tara gets up and heads for the intercom.  15.
Hey, freaklet. It's us.

JAMES, great-looking, tight T-shirt, gay, and RICHARD, he cubicle mate, standard Gen X uniform of worn corduroys an bowling shoes, bookend Tara. The television is a Sony fla screen, huge. Dana and James play a reality video game - BOXING.

Ah...22...what a wonderful age. I remember what twenty-two felt like...coénfident, that kind of confidence where you know exactly what you want and exactly how to get it. I wonder if this is the woman he almost married...I wonder why it didn't work out?

{looking at Tara) Or maybe it's more than that... Tara balls up the piece of paper.
I'm going to be an adult about this and just talk to Nate about what I know. Lay it out. Dana dangles the wad of paper in front of Tara's face.

Hello?

BUSY SIGNAL. A group of SUITS sit at a table in front of Nate. A GUY raps on the glass, pointing to the WAITER who stands at their table.
Tara begins stuffing back the contents of her purse when picks up the CRUMPLED PIECE OF PAPER: Jessica Fukunaga's work number in front of her. She stares at it.

Well Health Center.

As she realizes what kind of doctor Jessica Fukunaga is. nurse tosses a blue gown at Tara.

Open to the front. And with a stern look, she is gone. Tara STARES at the stirrups.

Tara nervously clutching the front of her gown. Tara look at her watch, reaching for her clothes. Just as she is ab to bail, DR. JESSICA FUKUNAGA walks in briskly, glancing Tara as she picks up the chart. She is pretty, her black hair cut in a Louise Brooks bob. Her big, brown eyes are kind, taking everything in.
Hi, I'm Dr. Fukunaga, nice to meet you. They shake hands.
Nice to meet you.
(marking on clipboard) How are you feeling?  28.

(noting her nervousness) About...? Tara looks around the room and spies a poster advertising brand of birth control pills.

Well then, if you've both been tested for HIV, you might want to consider birth control pills or a diaphragm. When was your last pelvic exam?

The cat...not the boyfriend. Jessica Fukunaga stands up, applying some KY to the end o her gloved fingers. She looks at Tara over her knees, concentrating.  31.

The laws of gravity say, what goes up... KATE CATES EMERGES from the kitchen with the mop just as EMERGES FROM THE BEDROOM. PIPPA ENTERS through the kitchen. JESSICA FUKUNAGA ENTERS carrying a huge potted palm. NATE RE-EMERGES FROM THE BATHROOM. They all STARE at one another in disbelief, various parti recognizing each other, EVERYONE recognizing disaster. SILENCE. Everyone turns on Tara.
Jessica Fukunaga walks briskly from the building. Followed quickly by Pippa, who turns and yells over her shoulder.
And you think I'm fucking nuts! Whew, you take the case -~ Kate Cates EXITS, Tara on her heels.

(turns) I really thought we were friends, I trusted you, Tara. What, was all that friendship just some kind of a fake out? Did you do all of that just to get to know my little secrets about Nate?  o7. Finally Dana, Nate and Alex emerge sheepishly, trying not look at this painful fight.
(choking up) No, Kate...I want us to remain friends -- Audrey steps out of a cab carrying a gift wrapped in baby paper.
I don't see why -~ (to Alex) And by the way, you're the father of my baby. I left for London because I was embarrassed that I cheated on Nate. (glaring at all of them, and then Tara)
Kate Cates runs down the street. Alex, stunned, looks aft her.
I'm a father? I'm someone's Dad and I didn't even know it -— (running after Kate) KATIE, wait up -- I want to meet him, I
Wait, Tara...that wasn’t your baby?
No, I tried to -~

What you won’t stoop to, unbelievable! Audrey turns and walks away. This leaves Dana who looks at Tara sympathetically and sl walks back inside, leaving Tara and Nate to face one othe The only sound is the dead leaves blowing across the sidewalk.
I don't know what to say.
r don't know if I want to hear it.  98.
Okay...well, we found out you're not a father...that's good, right? Nate shrugs.
That would've been okay.
Well then, what? Say something...anything.
Why? Why did you do this behind my back?

It just sort of happened. Nate looks at as if to say, “you’1l have to do better tha that.” TARA (cont! d) I...I heard about Kate...and then I found out she was a model...I was worried I wouldn’t measure up. You've been with all of these interesting women.
Tara —-
I know. I know.
What happened to honesty...and trust?

I guess I honestly wanted to know something that you didn’t trust me with. Nate turns and walks away. Tara goes to speak, her voice cracks. TARA (cont’d) And you didn’t trust me Nate, you didn’t...or you would have told me about your past. And without waiting for a response, Tara quickly turns an disappears back into the apartment.
Tara hovers above a young woman, JANET, who now trains fo her job. She is clearly nervous. Tara in comparison is composed, the seasoned veteran. Two lines ring at once.
Go ahead.
Audrey Lanford's office. She's not in right now, may I take a message? Janet searches the desk for a pad to write on, Tara suppl her with the phone log.
(whispers) Ask to put them on hold --
Can you hold please? Tara punches the second button. Janet takes down the messages.
AUDREY LANFORD'S OFFICE — LATER Tara staggers a half dozen newspapers on Audrey's desk.

She likes them in this order, New York Times, San Francisco Chronicle, Financial Times and then the Columbus Dispatch, she's from Ohio. Coffee, no cream or sugar, on the upper left hand corner. Phone calls or faxes on her chair so she can't miss them. When she walks in she likes the first ten minutes to collect her thoughts unless her boss, Jenkins, is on the line -~- Tara is unaware of it, but Audrey stands at the door watching. TARA (cont'd) She always wants to know when her mother or boyfriend Roger is on the phone, but she has two sisters, she usually will take Rhonda's call, but take a message from Carla -~  100. Audrey enters, nods. TARA (cont'd) Good morning. Audrey nods her hello. Tara and Janet brush past.
Don't bother telling her anything important until she's had two cups of coffee, she won't retain it.
Tara packs the very last of her belongings. She carefully puts a framed picture of Nate on top.
I have something to ask you...
Yeah, anything.
You're so amazing at this job. Can you tell me what you did to get fired, so I won't repeat it? Tara slips on her coat and picks up her box.
Trust me, there's no chance of that. Good luck, I'm sure you'll do a great job.
Tara and Dana hug.
I feel awful. I kicked you out of our apartment, you and Nate broke up, and now you've been fired.
I know, and it's all your fault.  101. Tara pulls away. TARA (cont'd) I'm kidding.
You know, you don’t have to move out now. You can stay..--
Thanks.
Have you called him...at all?
No. I don't think he ever wants to hear from me again.
It's been a couple of weeks...you should try. Dana's phone starts ringing, she runs around to the other side of the desk. Tara hoists her box up, and walks out.
Audrey catches Tara just as she is about to get on.
Tara, hey. I just wanted to give you this. Audrey hands Tara a chit of paper. AUDREY (cont'd) She's expecting your call. I would do it today if you can. Tara looks down at the piece of paper.
Beth Brown, the editor of GIRL POWER magazine?
That's right. I fired her years ago- Most of the top editors in this town were once employees of mine.  102.
Thank you, Audrey. But why am I calling...I mean, is it for an assistant position...or?
A writer...I think you're a terrible assistant. If I were you I would stick to the creative side of things. Good luck.
But, does that mean you read my -— Audrey walks away, stops.

I'm printing your article about exes, it'll be in this months magazine in our true stories section. Tara squeals and runs back to Audrey, about to hug her, Audrey puts up her hand to stop her. AUDREY (cont’d) Please, no physical contact. Audrey turns on her heel and walks away, a ghost of a smi crosses her face.
Tara exits the building. She looks up to see they are replacing the Calvin Klein billboard. Only half of Kate Cates face looms above Times Square. Tara stares at it as PEOPLE jostle her about.

head_text.subj: THE REAL KATE CATES. WE ARE

text: Her face as lovely as ever, put there is something differ about the way she looks, happy and peaceful. We hear laughing, and we now see who she's been watching...

running after each other in the park. Alex falls down and Joshua leaps on top of him, pummelling him.  103. They cover each other in the fall leaves, Josh's laugh contagious...Kate runs to join them. cuT TO:

Jessica sits at her kitchen table, working. She stops whe her cat jumps into her lap, putting a paw on her shoulder She strokes the cat, looking out the window. Jessica kisses the cat and then picks up the phone and quickly dials.
Hi, I was just calling to get the lab results of one of my patients. Yes, a Tara O'Connor...
Pippa is hard at work on a sculpture made of papier mache She works quickly, completely into what she is doing.
Tara and Dana walk out of a cute building on a street fil with cute buildings.
Are you sure you want to live way the hell out here?
Brooklyn's not that far out. Besides, I can't afford to live by myself in Manhattan.
I just feel so guilty that I kicked you out in the first place...and had James move in -~
No. I think living on my own is a good idea.
But you're going to be all alone --  104.

I'm going to be on my own, there's a difference. (beat) And when I get my shit together, I'm going to get Nate back. I miss him so much. Just then a BLONDE WOMAN strolling a baby carriage passes them going in the opposite direction. Tara spins around ~ TARA (cont'd) Kate -- Kate, it's Tara -~ KATE! Tara takes a few running steps in the woman's direction. woman finally turns around, but it's not Kate. Tara puts her hand in apology, slowly turning to face Dana.
It looks like Nate isn't the only one you miss.
Tara knocks on the door. After a moment Kate answers the door.
Before you slam the door in my face, which you have every right to do, I just want to tell you I'm sorry ~~ Kate lunges forward and gathers Tara up in an embrace. cur TO:
Tara sits on the edge of the table. Jessica Fukunaga walk in.
I just wanted to let you know in person —~
Am I dying?

You're normal. Completely healthy, like I said, we just had to do a second test to be sure.  105. Tara breaks down crying. Jessica puts her arm around her. JESSICA (cont'd) And even though it was completely insane, Tt understand what you did. I think we all understood. I would never do that myself, but it was kind of wild that you did. They hug. cuT TO:
Tara stands at the door, sifting through mail. She gets t rather large manila envelope and opens it. We look down t see an invitation to PIPPA ANDERS NEW WORK AT STUDIO 4. T smiles.

Tara and Dana enter the packed gallery. Photographers, celebrities, rich and starving artists all mix and mingle Tara scans the room looking for Pippa, jumps when she tur around and sees Nate -~- or what looks like Nate. In fact is a room FILLED WITH NATES. CARTOON PLASTER AND METAL REMAKES OF NATE being SWALLOWED TORTURED, FRIED. Duplicates of Nate everywhere being devoured and reshaped. The plaster Nates all look alike, except for their cause of death. Tara looks up to see: NATE SUSPENDED FROM THE CEILING...over to... NATE BEING TAKEN DOWN BY A PACK OF WOLVES... NATE DROWNING IN QUICKSAND. Finally, a LARGE STEEL JAW that rests in the middle of th floor. A tiny man TRAPPED inside, covered in a slime-like substance. A tinny recording of a blood curdling scream repeats endlessly. Walking up to the steel jaw, both Dana and Tara lean in simultaneously to read the placard. The neat black on whi understated print reads, DIGESTING NATE.  106. Tara is transfixed. She looks up to see Jessica and Kate Cates as well as Alex all standing around looking at it a well. Alex whistles. Pippa joins them.
Well...what do you think? The exhibit is called CLOSURE...thank you, Tara, for helping me with the idea.
You’ re welcome...it's great, really, amazing work Pippa. They hug briefly. TARA (cont'd) I wonder if Nate is coming...is he coming? Tara looks at Pippa and then Alex adjusts his tie.
Uh...didn't you know, Tara?
What?
He took that job...in San Francisco.
Oh? Tara instantly deflates. She tears up, everyone looks at her. TARA (cont'd) But I thought he turned them down...T thought --
They still wanted him. So, he said yes.
But I was going to try and, and see him...it's too late. How could he be gone?
He's not. Tara looks up hopefully.  107. ALEX (cont'd) Well...he leaves tonight.
When, what time?
(glancing at watch) His flight takes off in two hours. Tara looks at everyone.
I need to stop him...I'll never get there in time - oh God. Just then a good-looking, built GUY wearing a police unif comes up and puts his arms around Pippa's waist.
Hey, how's it going? Pippa smiles, turning to look at her new beau.
Maybe we can get you there in time.
Tara, Dana, Kate and Jessica are crammed in the back of t cop car. Pippa is in front with her guy OFFICER BILL, they're practically making out. The SIRENS going.
Isn't this illegal...I mean, using a police vehicle for something -~-
You'd be surprised how often we do this -~
Can you go any faster? Officer Bill puts pedal to the metal, they all SCREAM.
They pull up at drop-off.  108.
Now remember, Nate likes an honest apology, sincerity --
Also, don't try and turn it back on him, he doesn't like to be wrong -~
And an offer of a blow job on the way home may not be a bad idea -~-
Pippa --
Okay, okay, but just keep it simple. You fucked up, no one is permanently damaged, you're sorry.
Right. Thanks guys...I love you! Collective hug.
Nate pulls up in a cab a few cars down from them. He gets out and heads inside.
Tara looks around wildly, heading for the American Airlin check in.
Nate heads straight for the baggage check-in. Goes throug Tara appears, sees him right in front of her. She runs to through and is stopped by a security agent.
Ticket, please.
{ don't have one, I'm just --
Sorry, no ticket, no entry into the gangway -—  109.
See that guy, I have to see him before he leaves, please -- can't you stop him?
No. Tara gives him a dirty look.
(screams)
A few PEOPLE turn around, but her voice sounds small and quickly disappears.
Are you going to be a problem, because I don't want to have to call back up if I don't have to. cuT TO:
~ Tara quickly dials.
STARBUCKS - TERMINAL — SAME Nate stands in line, checks his watch. The phone rings.
Hello?
Nate, hi, it's me...don't hang up. I'm here at the airport, they won't let me through without a ticket. Nate steps up one more in line.
What are you doing?
Apologizing...
T don't want you to leave. I want to be with you. I know what I did was insane. Nate, I'm sorry, I'm so --
Caramel Macchiata, no foam --
What?
Nothing...I'm ordering a coffee...
Aren't those a little sweet? I thought you took your coffee black --
When I'm at a Starbucks I splurge.
Oh. (beat) See...I didn't know that about you....please don't leave. I love you so much...I can't just let you leave.
Nate looks back to the general area that Tara is standing The following is INTERCUT:
I'll call you when I get to San Francisco.
(chokes up) You're going? Nate visibly softens.
CARAMEL MACCHIATA NO FOAM -~—
Well...that's you.  i111. Nate starts running back to the main part of the terminal
Yep..
Now boarding American Airlines Flight 263 bound for San Francisco, now boarding...
That's you too, uh?
Nate runs through to the terminal, searching all of the p pooths...he finally spies Tara, curled into the phone, fa away from him. He stops, slowly walks towards her.
Did I ever tell you about Missy Hogan?
Who?
From kindergarten, my first girlfriend. Nate now stands about ten feet from Tara, he watches her through the crowd.
(laughing) No...so, was she hot?
Incredible...strawberry blonde, freckles like you have...she used to stick gum in my hair. She smelled of gum and Tinker Bell perfume...and then there was Dolly in first grade --
What happened to Missy? Nate steadily approaches.
I caught her kissing someone else in the cloak room, then it was all over...but Dolly, she was a hot little number.  112.
I'm jealous... Nate now stands inches from Tara.

See...that's why I never wanted to talk about ex-girlfriends... Tara, hearing him, feeling him, turns around. They face e other, still holding their phones. He leans in and kisses ner...it is a classic, romantic comedy end of the movie k Then...Nate pulls away. NATE (cont'd) I've got a plane to catch -~- He kisses her quickly and starts to turn away. Tara follo
Are you kidding, what, you're -~
I'm still taking the job, honey, I accepted, I have an apartment, my plane is boarding now, I have to —~ Tara, flabbergasted, tries to re-group.
But, I thought -~

Look, we're going to try and make this work...it will be long distance and it will be hard, but we have weekends...and then we'll see. Just trust that it will work...I think we have a pretty good chance.
Trust... They kiss again quickly and Nate stares deeply into her e
I'll call you as soon as I get there --

Call before...on one of those airplane phones.  113. Nate turns and runs back through security, leaving Tara a in the terminal. He turns and waves just before he walks through and disappears...but not for good. INT. DANA'S APARTMENT — NIGHT Tara sits curled up on the couch, cradling the phone.
That's when I was fourteen. God, was she beautiful. She was French. And then the next summer, I was a camp counselor...Monique, she was older and -- Tara nods.
Okay, okay, 1 think I got the picture.
We haven't even gotten out of high school yet.
Well...maybe we should just talk about them when it's...relevant. Tara laughs as he begins to protest.
